seo.title: Guide till Sorrento (porten till Amalfikusten)
seo.description: Varför Sorrento är en bra bas: transporter, boende, sevärdheter och praktiska tips.

intro: Sorrento is a practical base: plenty of accommodation, easy rail links, and fast connections to Capri and Pompeii. The trade-off is fewer postcard views than Positano.

sections.title: Why base in Sorrento
body: More accommodation choice and straightforward train access. Trade-off: less postcard scenery than Positano.

sections.title: Connections to Positano
body: Frequent SITA buses and seasonal ferries. Buy bus tickets before boarding; ferries can sell out on peak days.

sections.title: What to see
body: Historic center, marinas, and viewpoints; a handy jumping-off point for Capri and Pompeii.

a: Generally yes—expect accommodation savings of €30–€60 per night and more dining options at mid-range prices.

faqs.q: How late do trains run back to Naples?
a: The Circumvesuviana runs until around 22:30; after that, use regional buses or plan to overnight if you have a late flight.
